title: Replace displayed Bitcoin payment address with new BTC address

requirements.text: Update the hardcoded Bitcoin payment address used during checkout so that newly created orders use and display the BTC address `12usSpmU49fnNfm7VuoGkvkoT47jS5snri` instead of the current `1A1...` address.

quotes:
1 or Chez Jb Payment BTC Address Show hota 1A1.. wala uski jaga ye Wala Replace krdu

12usSpmU49fnNfm7VuoGkvkoT47jS5snri

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/pages/CheckoutPage.tsx, the fixed `btcAddress` value used when submitting `createOrder` is changed to `12usSpmU49fnNfm7VuoGkvkoT47jS5snri`.
After placing a new order, the checkout success screen’s “Bitcoin Address” field shows `12usSpmU49fnNfm7VuoGkvkoT47jS5snri`.
For a newly created order, the order status page shows the same updated BTC address (as stored on the order).

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
Keep the backend single-actor architecture (all Motoko logic remains in backend/main.mo).
nonGoals: Do not change order status logic, tracking pages, or any other checkout fields beyond the BTC address replacement.
Do not attempt to retroactively change BTC addresses for orders that were already created with the old address.
